DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study is being conducted to evaluate whether consumption of diet soda sweetened with sucralose and acesulfame-potassium leads to changes in the gut microbiota. Following a one week run-in period, healthy, young adults are randomized to consume either diet soda or carbonated water (control) three times per day for one week. Stool and urine samples are collected at baseline, following the run-in, and after the one-week intervention.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Non-nutritive Sweeteners on the Composition of the Gut Microbiome
DOC.criteria: Healthy adults aged 1835 years Consume less than 1 food/beverage with nonnutritive sweeteners per month Able and willing to consume diet soda three times daily for 1 week Recent diet or significant weight change Antibiotic use in the past 3 months Diarrhea in the past two weeks Use of medications known to affect metabolism or weight Weight < 50 kg (110 lbs.) History of metabolic complications including high blood sugar, elevated cholesterol, or liver disease
